item.title: Create and implement an AWS Budget for monthly forecasted cost
item.description: Budgets allow you to manage cost and usage by providing notifications when cost or usage are outside of configured amounts. They cannot be used to restrict actions, only notify on usage after it has occurred. Budgets and notifications are updated when your billing data is updated, which is at least once per day. NOTE: You may not receive an alarm for a forecasted budget if your account is new. Forecasting requires existing usage within the account.

item.title: Create and implement an AWS Budget for EC2 actual cost
item.description: We will create a monthly EC2 actual cost budget, which will notify if the actual costs of EC2 instances exceeds the specified amount. item.title: Create and implement an AWS Budget for EC2 Savings Plan coverage
item.description: We will create a monthly savings plan coverage budget which will notify if the coverage of Savings Plan for EC2 is below the specified amount. item.title: Create and implement an AWS Budget Report
item.description: AWS Budgets Reports allow you to create and send daily, weekly, or monthly reports to monitor the performance of your AWS Budgets.
